tournament.name: Grand Prix Los Angeles 2016 - Trial Winners

decks.notes: This deck is focused on generating mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Aether Vial and Grand Architect, while using Pili-Pala to create infinite mana. This mana can then be used to cast powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Whispers of the Muse multiple times in a single turn. The deck also includes strong creatures like Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage to control the board and finish off the opponent. The key strategy is to set up the infinite mana combo and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with useful abilities to assemble powerful combinations that can quickly win the game. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Nahiri, the Harbinger, the deck can tutor for specific creatures like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch to create an infinite combo. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility in responding to different situations, with cards like Aven Mindcensor and Fulminator Mage disrupting opponents while Eternal Witness and Reveillark provide recursion. The deck aims to control the board while setting up its game-winning combos.

This deck aims to assemble a combination of creatures with varying abilities and synergies to create a powerful toolbox that can adapt to different situations. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the deck can tutor for specific creatures to control the board, gain life, disrupt opponents' strategies, and eventually combo off for a win. The creatures in the deck work together to create a versatile and resilient strategy that can outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with their size and abilities. It also includes disruptive spells like Thought-Knot Seer to help control the opponent's hand and board state. The deck also utilizes ramp spells like Talisman of Impulse and Sylvan Scrying to accelerate into its larger threats. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells gives the deck a proactive game plan that can quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

A fast and aggressive Eldrazi deck that aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruption. It utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kozilek's Return. The deck also has ramp options like Talisman of Impulse and Sylvan Scrying to help accelerate its plays. With a mix of big threats and efficient removal, this deck looks to close out games quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays using cheap and efficient Goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The strategy is to flood the board with low-cost creatures and use burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Grenade to deal damage directly to the opponent or remove blockers. Cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Legion Loyalist provide additional benefits when attacking with the goblin army. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and finish off the opponent before they can mount a strong defense.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources and game plan through tax effects such as Leonin Arbiter, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Tidehollow Sculler, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck uses flicker effects from Eldrazi Displacer and Flickerwhisp to continuously disrupt the opponent's board and hand, along with removal spells like Path to Exile and Wasteland Strangler. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Infect mechanic to win the game quickly by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent. By playing creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to deal damage in the form of poison counters rather than reducing the opponent's life total to zero. Protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Vines of Vastwood help to ensure that the infect creatures can get through to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and land ramp to help maintain consistency and speed.

This deck focuses on quickly building up poison counters on the opponent through the use of infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf. The key strategy is to pump up these creatures with spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth, protecting them with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing. By overwhelming the opponent with poison counters, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can effectively respond. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to execute its infect strategy efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with big creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach to cheat them into play for a quick win. It also utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Izzet Charm for card filtering and protection, while Nourishing Shoal helps gain life to stay alive. The combo aspect comes from the ability to reanimate these big creatures at instant speed, catching opponents off guard and overwhelming them with massive threats.

This Jund deck aims to aggressively control the board with a mixture of efficient creatures and removal spells. By disrupting the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, and removing threats with Lightning Bolt, Abrupt Decay, and Terminate, it can quickly overpower the opponent. The deck also benefits from the card advantage generated by Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil, while also applying pressure with Tarmogoyf. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its aggressive potential.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Lingering Souls, while also using discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile to deal with threats, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to control the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive Merfolk tribal strategy. By playing efficient Merfolk creatures such as Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, you can quickly build a board presence and pump up your creatures with islandwalk. Using cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while increasing the power of your own creatures. With a mix of creature buffs and disruption spells, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver your opponent for a quick victory.

This Modern Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board of tribal creatures with powerful synergies. By utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, it can pump up its creatures and overwhelm opponents. Cards like Spreading Seas disrupt the opponent's mana base while Merrow Reejerey and Aether Vial provide additional utility in the form of tempo advantage. The deck aims to establish an aggressive board presence and push through damage efficiently, taking advantage of tribal synergies to outmaneuver and outpace opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Mono Green creature strategy. Key cards like Avatar of the Resolute, Leatherback Baloth, and Collected Company provide powerful threats early in the game, while pump spells like Aspect of Hydra and Rancor help push through damage. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently, using resilient creatures like Dungrove Elder and Scavenging Ooze to maintain board presence. With a strong mana base and consistent creature curve, this deck is designed to outpace and overpower the opposition.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with Nahiri, the Harbinger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Key cards like Lightning Bolt, Path to Exile, and Cryptic Command provide the necessary interaction to handle a variety of threats. The mana base is well-tuned to support the control elements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure early in the game. Atarka's Command and Boros Charm provide additional reach and flexibility in closing out the game. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for smooth gameplay and explosive starts. Overall, this deck is built to be a relentless force that aims to win the game as quickly as possible.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through various spells like Bring to Light, Remand, and Path to Exile, while ramping up mana with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow. The deck aims to eventually win by playing Scapeshift to enable Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal a significant amount of damage to the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes Glittering Wish to tutor for additional answers from the sideboard and uses cards like Ghostly Prison and Wall of Omens for additional defense and card advantage.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by playing powerful red creatures and spells while disrupting the opponent with removal, board wipes, and land disruption. The deck focuses on utilizing the mana acceleration of cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Koth of the Hammer to cast big threats like Boros Reckoner and Stormbreath Dragon. Blood Moon and Skred provide additional disruption by locking down the opponent's mana base and removing threats, making it difficult for them to stabilize. This deck aims to control the game and win through overwhelming board presence and damage.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through efficient removal and powerful threats while ramping up mana with the Urza lands to quickly cast game-ending spells such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger or Karn Liberated. The deck focuses on assembling Tron as quickly as possible using Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, while also using cards like Chromatic Sphere and Chromatic Star to filter mana and draw additional cards. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spellskite and Oblivion Stone, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Khalni Heart Expedition, in order to quickly find and play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By using cards like Scapeshift and Primeval Titan, the goal is to deal massive amounts of damage by triggering Valakut multiple times in one turn, ultimately overwhelming the opponent's life total and winning the game in a single explosive turn. The deck also includes some control elements like Anger of the Gods to deal with aggressive opponents.
